text:
When setting up a master buildfile it would be beneficial to allow target
definitions to be inherited by lower level subprojects when using the Ant task.
 This would allow for generic targets to be written at the top (like compile)
and to used by  all subprojects where the only change would be a property that
defines the source tree for each subproject.
creator: jeff.edrington@sun.com
stevel@apache.org
text:
You mean like if we had a way to <include> a set of definitions for re-use? Or
we support a mechanism to define an XML entity and then &expand; it in the sub
projects?

creator: jeff.edrington@sun.com
text:
I guess that an <include> element could work however I was thinking that
subprojects could inherit targets automatically from the parent much like
'export' works in the shell.  Maybe we can add an attribute in the <target>
element that allows this target to be used by subprojects such as:

<target xyz depends="aaa" export="yes">

Axis already has an XML entity inclusion; ant1.6 adds <include>. Then there is
target reuse through <ant>. 

So all you want can probably be done today, the only issue is "is there a more
elegant approach", just as C++ initially added nothing that wasnt in C, just
made it usable.
creator: stevel@apache.org
